sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"新闻，消息，情报"之意。
means: news ： 普通用词，指主要通过报纸、广播和电视等报道的事件，强调消息的新闻性。
information ： 普通用词，泛指消息、情报。
intelligence ： 特指政治、经济、文化或军事等方面的秘密情报或消息。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 新的, 初见的, 更新的
stems_affixes.word_buile: new新的→adj.新的, 初见的, 更新的 adv.新近
new新的→adj.新的, 初见的, 更新的 adv.新近
new新的+s复数→很多新的在一起→新闻
re重新+new新的→v.[使]更新, 使恢复

(proverb)without information to the contrary you can assume that all is well

entry.def: News is information about a recently changed situation or a recent event.

example.ex: We waited and waited for news of him...
example.tran: 我们左等右等，盼着他的消息。

example.ex: They still haven't had any news about when they'll be able to go home...
example.tran: 他们仍然没有何时能回家的消息。

entry.def: News is information that is published in newspapers and broadcast on radio and television about recent events in the country or world or in a particular area of activity.

example.ex: We'll also have the latest sports news...
example.tran: 我们也会收到最新的体育新闻。

entry.def: The news is a television or radio broadcast which consists of information about recent events in the country or the world.

example.ex: I heard all about the bombs on the news.
example.tran: 我从新闻广播里得知了关于炸弹的全部消息。

entry.def: News is sometimes used in the names of newspapers.

If you say that someone or something is news, you mean that they are considered to be interesting and important at the moment, and that people want to hear about them on the radio and television and in newspapers.

example.tran: 谋杀案是重大新闻事件。

example.ex: If you are a celebrity, you are headline news.
example.tran: 如果你是名人，你就是头条新闻。

entry.def: If you say that something is bad news, you mean that it will cause you trouble or problems. If you say that something is good news, you mean that it will be useful or helpful to you.

example.ex: The drop in travel is bad news for the airline industry...
example.tran: 旅游热降温对航空业来说是个坏消息。

example.ex: This new attitude is good news to AIDS activists.
example.tran: 这种新态度对艾滋病活动家来说是件好事。

entry.def: If you say that something is news to you, you mean that you did not previously know what you have just been told, especially when you are surprised or annoyed about it.

example.ex: I'd certainly tell you if I knew anything, but I don't. What you're saying is news to me.
example.tran: 如果我真知道什么的话，我肯定会告诉你，可我不知道。你现在说的我都没听过。

means.word_mean: 1. new information about specific and timely events;

sentences.sentence: "we watch the 7 o'clock news every night"

means.word_mean: 4. information reported in a newspaper or news magazine;

sentences.sentence: "the news of my death was greatly exaggerated"

means.word_mean: 5. the quality of being sufficiently interesting to be reported in news bulletins;

sentences.sentence: "the judge conceded the newsworthiness of the trial"
"he is no longer news in the fashion world"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: plural of new, translating Old French noveles or medieval Latin nova 'new things'

sentences.cn: 有什么最新消息吗？
sentences.en: What's the latest news?

sentences.cn: 你听说了吗？帕特要走了！
sentences.en: Have you heard the news? Pat's leaving!

sentences.cn: 这真是好消息。
sentences.en: That's great news.

sentences.cn: 把你最近的情况全都告诉我。
sentences.en: Tell me all your news.

sentences.en: This new attitude is good news to AIDS activists.

sentences.cn: 如果我真知道什么的话，我肯定会告诉你，可我不知道。你现在说的我都没听过。
sentences.en: I'd certainly tell you if I knew anything, but I don't. What you're saying is news to me.

sentences.cn: 还有关于最近刚收养了孩子（并刚成为单身）的妈妈桑德拉.布鲁克的报道；也有常常出现的“詹妮弗.安妮斯顿已经怀孕”的新闻。
sentences.en: There are also stories about newly adoptive – and newly single – mom Sandra Bullock, as well as the usual "Jennifer Aniston is pregnant" news.

sentences.cn: 用新闻专栏中引用的一些科学家的话来说，喜欢这些奖项的理由有很多。
sentences.en: Quite a lot, according to a handful of scientists quoted in the News Feature.

sentences.cn: 她认为,这种同样的道德目的的缺失正在伤害着诸如“新闻国际”这样的公司,使它更有可能像曾经的大规模非法电话窃听一样迷失方向。
sentences.en: This same absence of moral purpose was wounding companies such as News International ,she thought ,making it more likely that it would lose its way as it had with widespread illegal telephone hacking .

sentences.cn: 正如2001年受雇于《世界新闻报》的格伦·穆尔凯尔所承认的样,此次窃听行为已达到行业规模,他是电话窃听案的关键人物。
sentences.en: This is hacking on an industrial scale ,as was acknowledged by Glenn Mulcaire, the man hired by the News of the World in 2001 to be the point person for phone hacking.

sentences.cn: 编辑《世界新闻报》的目的不是为了促进读者的理解,不是为了追求所写内容的公平,也不是为了揭露任何共同的人性。
sentences.en: The purpose of editing the News of the World was not to promote reader understanding to be fair in what was written or to betray any common humanity.

sentences.cn: 据牛津大学的数据显示，2016年总统大选期间，在政治上处于关键地位的密歇根州，其推特用户分享的近四分之一的网页内容属于虚假新闻。
sentences.en: During the 2016 presidential campaign, nearly a quarter of web content shared by Twitter users in the politically critical state of Michigan was fake news, according to the University of Oxford.

sentences.cn: 另外,一项专门为 BuzzFeed新闻版块开展的调查发现，44%的脸书用户很少或从不相信来自这个媒体巨头的新闻报道。
sentences.en: And a survey conducted for Buzz Feed News found 44 percent of Facebook users rarely or never trust news from the media giant.

sentences.cn: 约三分之一的美国人认为虚假新闻的问题在于人们通过社交媒体“对事实新闻进行扭曲或夸大”。
sentences.en: About a third say the problem of fake news lies in “misinterpretation or exaggeration of actual news" via social media.

sentences.cn: 换句话说，选择在社交媒体上分享新闻可能才是该问题出现的症结所在。
sentences.en: In other words, the choice to share news on social media may be the heart of the issue.

sentences.cn: 言外之意就是，千禧一代更希望白宫的消息通过其他渠道传播，而不是总统的社交媒体平台。
sentences.en: The implication is that Millennials prefer news from the White House to be filtered through other sources, not a president's social media platform.

sentences.cn: 很多人谈到劳工部六月份公布的28.8万个新增岗位以及失业率下降至6.1%时都视其为好消息。
sentences.en: Many people talked of the 288,000 new jobs the Labor Department reported for June ,along with the drop in the unemployment rate to 6.1 percent ,as good news.

sentences.cn: 青少年培养自己的兴趣，这没什么问题，而且很健康。年轻人能与亲友和睦相处，这也是个好消息。
sentences.en: It is fine and healthy for teens to cultivate their personal interests, and it is good news when young people enjoy harmonious relations with their family and friends.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 众议院和参议院金融委员会各通过了一项议案，两项议案打算实施或检验多项改革措施，这些改革有助于放慢医疗成本的长期上涨趋势，这是一个好消息。
sentences.en: The good news is that a bill just approved by the House and a bill approved by the Senate Finance Committee would implement or test many reforms that should help slow the rise in medical costs over the long term.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 所以美国有线电视公司Cablevision 将在10月6 日向它的所有客户推出交互式广告的消息受到了一些人的质疑。
sentences.en: So the news that Cablevision, an American cable company, was rolling out interactive advertisements to all its customers on October 6th was greeted with some skepticism.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 这对一些公司而言是个坏消息，它们寄希望于智能手表能快步赶上智能手机与平板电脑的成熟市场。
sentences.en: That  is  bad  news  for  any  firm  that  may  hope  that smartwatches  can  make  up  ground  for  maturing  smartphone and  tablet  markets.
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 你可能已经意识到，关于就业市场的最新消息不容乐观：失业率仍高于 9% ，而新的就业增长率几乎已跌至零。
sentences.en: As you are probably aware, the latest job markets news isn’t good: Unemployment is still more than 9 percent, and new job growth has fallen close to zero.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 进一步来说，我们通常生活在以新事物或流行事物为价值导向的社会中。我们对英语的使用对于美国老年人来说也是个坏消息。
sentences.en: Furthermore, we often live in societies that value what is “new” or in fashion, and our own usage of words in the English language is often a sign of bad news for older Americans
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 男：咱们从坏消息开始吧，美国人在运用技术方面实在是太差了，比如使用电子邮件、给电脑文件命名、使用网页链接乃至于仅仅是给什么人发短信。

sentences.en: The news of rigged ballots has rubbed off much of the shine of their election victory.
